name: Titanium.Network
doc:
@platform android 0.8 @platform blackberry 3.1.2 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @platform mobileweb 1.8 @editurl https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/edit/master/apidoc/Titanium/Network/Network.yml

The top level network module.

@description

The Network module is used to access networking related functionality.

For TCP sockets, see Titanium.Network.Socket.TCP.

The legacy Titanium.Network.TCPSocket object is still required by the BonjourBrowser and BonjourService objects.

For all other socket needs, use Titanium.Network.Socket.TCP.

property.name: INADDR_ANY
property.doc: Special hostname value for listening sockets, representing all locally available network interfaces.
property.shortDoc:
Special hostname value for listening sockets, representing all
locally available network interfaces. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated

1.7.0

@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8

property.name: NETWORK_LAN
property.doc:
A networkType value indicating that the device is communicating over a local-area network.

@description

This network type is only used by the Mobile Web platform, when the application is running in a desktop browser attached to a LAN.

This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

@platform android 0.8 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @platform mobileweb 1.8
property.shortDoc:
A networkType value indicating that the device is
communicating over a local-area network. ...

property.name: NETWORK_MOBILE
property.doc:
A networkType value indicating that the device is communicating over a mobile network.

@description

This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

@platform android 0.8 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @platform mobileweb 1.8
property.shortDoc:
A networkType value indicating that the device is
communicating over a mobile network. ...

property.name: NETWORK_NONE
property.doc:
A networkType value indicating that no network is available.

@description

This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

@platform android 0.8 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @platform mobileweb 1.8
property.shortDoc:
A networkType value indicating that no
network is available. ...

property.name: NETWORK_UNKNOWN
property.doc:
A networkType value indicating that the
current network type is unknown.

@description

This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

@platform android 0.8 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @platform mobileweb 1.8
property.shortDoc:
A networkType value indicating that the 
current network type is unknown. ...

property.name: NETWORK_WIFI
property.doc:
A networkType value indicating that the
device is communicating over a WiFi network.

@description

This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

@platform android 0.8 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @platform mobileweb 1.8
property.shortDoc:
A networkType value indicating that the 
device is communicating over a WiFi network. ...

property.name: apiName
property.doc:
The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to.

@description

The value of this property is the fully qualified name of the API. For example, Button returns Ti.UI.Button.

@platform android 3.2.0 @platform blackberry 3.2.0 @platform iphone 3.2.0 @platform ipad 3.2.0 @platform mobileweb 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to. ...

property.name: bubbleParent
property.doc:
Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent.

@description

Some proxies (most commonly views) have a relationship to other proxies, often established by the add() method. For example, for a button added to a window, a click event on the button would bubble up to the window. Other common parents are table sections to their rows, table views to their sections, and scrollable views to their views. Set this property to false to disable the bubbling to the proxy's parent.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0
property.shortDoc: Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent. ...

property.name: httpURLFormatter
property.doc:
User-defined function that is called everytime HTTPClient connects to a remote resource.

@description

The URL to connect to is passed in as the only function argument, and the function is expected to return a URL. The function should return null if an error occurs, which will cancel the HTTP request.

This function allows URLs to be formatted for use with the application's proxy to get around cross domain issues.

@platform mobileweb 1.8
property.shortDoc: User-defined function that is called everytime HTTPClient connects to a remote resource. ...

property.name: lifecycleContainer
property.doc:
The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy.

@description

If this property is set to a Window or TabGroup, then the corresponding Activity lifecycle event callbacks will also be called on the proxy. Proxies that require the activity lifecycle will need this property set to the appropriate containing Window or TabGroup.

@platform android 3.6.0
property.shortDoc: The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy. ...

property.name: networkType
property.doc:
Network type value as a constant.

@description

One of the NETWORK constants defined in Titanium.Network.

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • NETWORK_LAN
  • NETWORK_MOBILE
  • NETWORK_NONE
  • NETWORK_UNKNOWN
  • NETWORK_WIFI
property.shortDoc: Network type value as a constant. ...

property.name: networkTypeName
property.doc: Network type as a String. Returns one of NONE, WIFI, LAN, MOBILE, or UNKNOWN.
property.shortDoc: Network type as a String. ...

property.name: online
property.doc:
Boolean value indicating if the device can reach the Internet.

@description

The online property is true if the device can currently reach the Internet using either WiFi, mobile network or LAN.
property.shortDoc: Boolean value indicating if the device can reach the Internet. ...

method.name: addEventListener
method.doc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

params.doc: Name of the event.

method.shortDoc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

method.name: addHTTPCookie
method.doc:
Adds a cookie to the HTTP client cookie store.

@description

On iOS, the cookie will override an existing cookie with the same name, domain and path, if any. The cookie's expiryDate property must be a date later than the creating date, otherwise the cookie will not persist in the cookie storage. On Android, any existing cookie with the same domain and name will be replaced with the new cookie. This is a bug in BasicCookieStore because based on RFC6265, an existing cookie can be evicted and replaced only when it has the same cookie-name, domain-value and path-value with the new cookie.

params.name: cookie
params.doc:
The cookie to add

@platform android 3.2.0 @platform iphone 3.3.0 @platform ipad 3.3.0

method.shortDoc: Adds a cookie to the HTTP client cookie store. ...

method.name: addSystemCookie
method.doc:
Adds a cookie to the system cookie store.

@description

On Android, Titanium.UI.WebView uses the system cookie store. Any existing cookie with the same domain, path and name will be replaced with the new cookie.

params.name: cookie
params.doc:
The cookie to add

@platform android 3.2.0

method.shortDoc: Adds a cookie to the system cookie store. ...

method.name: applyProperties
method.doc:
Applies the properties to the proxy.

@description

Properties are supplied as a dictionary. Each key-value pair in the object is applied to the proxy such that myproxy[key] = value.

params.name: props
params.doc:
A dictionary of properties to apply.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform blackberry 3.3.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0 @platform mobileweb 3.0.0

method.shortDoc: Applies the properties to the proxy. ...

method.name: encodeURIComponent
method.doc:
Returns a URI encoded version of the specified URI component.

@description

On iOS, this also escapes the following characters, which are allowed in a URL but may not be allowed or desirable inside a path component:

!*'();:@+$,/?%#[]=&

params.name: value
params.doc: Input value to be encoded.

method.shortDoc: Returns a URI encoded version of the specified URI component. ...

method.name: getSystemCookies
method.doc:
Gets all the cookies with the domain, path and name matched with the given values from the system cookie store.

@description

On Android, Titanium.UI.WebView uses the system cookie store. The domain matching and path matching follow RFC6265. If name is null, return all the cookies with the domain and path matched. The returned cookies only have their name and value properties returned.

params.doc: The domain of the cookie to get. It is case-insensitive.

params.name: path
params.doc: The path of the cookie to get. It is case-sensitive.

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the cookie to get. It is case-sensitive.

method.shortDoc: Gets all the cookies with the domain, path and name matched with the given values from the system cookie store. ...

method.name: registerForPushNotifications
method.doc:
Registers for push notifications with the Apple Push Notification Service.

@description

Call this method at application startup.

For iOS 8 and later, before calling this method, the application needs to call the Titanium.App.iOS.registerUserNotificationSettings method and pass it the notification types to use. Setting the notification types with this method will have no effect on iOS 8 and later.

For iOS 7 and earlier, set the notification types to use with this method.

params.name: config
params.doc:
Dictionary specifying push-notification related options.

@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8

method.shortDoc: Registers for push notifications with the Apple Push Notification Service. ...

method.name: removeEventListener
method.doc:
Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

@description

Multiple listeners can be registered for the same event, so the callback parameter is used to determine which listener to remove.

When adding a listener, you must save a reference to the callback function in order to remove the listener later:

var listener = function() { Ti.API.info("Event listener called."); }
window.addEventListener('click', listener);

To remove the listener, pass in a reference to the callback function:

window.removeEventListener('click', listener);

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to remove. Must be the same function passed to addEventListener.

method.shortDoc: Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

method.name: unregisterForPushNotifications
method.doc:
Unregisters the application for push notifications.

@description

Per Apple's documentation, it is rarely necessary to call this method. See: unregisterForRemoteNotifications in the UIApplication Class Reference

For example, calling this method would be required if a new version of your application no longer supports push notifications.

@platform android 0.8 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @platform mobileweb 1.8
method.shortDoc: Unregisters the application for push notifications. ...

params.name: networkTypeName
params.doc: New network type as a string.

params.name: online
params.doc: Boolean to indicate if the device is online.

params.name: networkType
params.doc:
New network type

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • NETWORK_LAN
  • NETWORK_MOBILE
  • NETWORK_NONE
  • NETWORK_UNKNOWN
  • NETWORK_WIFI

(android mobileweb) reason

Human-readable text describing the reason for the change.

(android iphone ipad) source

Source object that fired the event.

(android iphone ipad) type

Name of the event fired.

(android iphone ipad) bubbles

True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

(android iphone ipad) cancelBubble

Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.
